txt1: The following description is about the budget preparation process. It begins when you record basic details.  When recording basic details is completed, you need to evaluate any significant variances. After evaluating any significant variances, prioritizing three to five goals needs to be done.  When prioritizing three to five goals is completed, one or more of the following paths should be executed: calculating the total annual budget, listing all department expenses.  Once listing all department expenses occurs, estimating the average monthly cost needs to be done.  Afterwards, you need to project total annual income. Once projecting total annual income occurs, recording financial data in a budget spreadsheet needs to be done.  Once recording financial data in a budget spreadsheet occurs, requesting approval from top management should be done.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The following description is about the budget preparation process. It begins when you record basic details. When the basic details are completed, you should evaluate any significant variances. After evaluating significant variances, it is important to prioritize three to five goals. When prioritizing three to five goals is completed, one or more of the following paths should be executed: calculating the annual budget, revealing all expenses of the department. Once the record of all department expenses comes into play, it needs to be estimated the average monthly cost. Afterwards, you need to project the total annual income. Once total annual income is projected, financial data needs to be recorded in a budget spreadsheet. Once financial data in a budget sheet occurs, it should be done to request approval by the top management. The process is now completed.

txt1: The following text is about the budget preparation process. It starts with setting target date for approval.  When setting target date for approval is completed, one or more of the following paths should be executed: reviewing the most recent budget, evaluating any significant variances.  Afterwards, the next tasks should be prioritizing three to five goals and determining ways of achieving the goals, they should be done in parallel.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then the next tasks should be estimating the average monthly cost and listing all department expenses, they should be done in parallel.  Once estimating the average monthly cost occurs, you need to calculate the total annual budget. Once all pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed: listing all sources of income, projecting total annual income.  After that, one or more of the following paths should be executed: finalizing the budget, recording financial data in a budget spreadsheet.  Afterwards, one or more of the following paths should be executed: requesting approval from top management, incorporating into the master budget.  After incorporating into the master budget, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: obtaining approval from top management and assigning management responsibilities.  The process is now completed.

Afterwards, one or more of the following lines should be executed: requiring approval from top management, including into the master budget. After incorporating in the master budget, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: obtaining approval from the top management and assigning management responsibilities. The process has now been finished.

txt1: The following text is about the budget preparation process. It starts with recording basic details.  Once recording basic details occurs, reviewing the most recent budget should be done.  Once reviewing the most recent budget occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: defining three to five goals, prioritizing three to five goals.  Afterwards, one or more of the following paths should be executed: listing all department expenses, calculating the total annual budget, estimating the average monthly cost.  After that, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: projecting total annual income and listing all sources of income.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed: finalizing the budget, recording financial data in a budget spreadsheet.  Afterwards, the next tasks should be incorporating into the master budget and assigning management responsibilities, they should be done in parallel.  When incorporating into the master budget is completed, the next tasks should be obtaining approval from top management and requesting approval from top management, they should be done in parallel.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The following text is about the budget preparation process; it starts with the basic information. Once the basic details occur, a review of the most recent budget should be done. Once a review of the most recent budget occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: identifying three to five goals, prioritizing three to five goals. Afterwards, one or more of the following paths should be executed: listing all departmental expenses, calculating the total annual budget, and estimating the average monthly cost. The process is then split into 2 parallel branches: projecting total annual income and listing all income sources. Once all pre-tasks are executed, one or more of the following paths should be executed: preparing the budget, recording financial data in a budget spreadsheet. After that, the next tasks should be incorporating into the master budget and assigning management responsibilities. They should be done parallel. When the incorporation to the master budget is completed the next task should be obtaining approval from the top management and requesting approval from the top management. These tasks should be done in parallel. The process is now complete.

These tasks should be conducted in parallel. Once all pre-tasks are executed, you then need to list all the sources of income. Once the list of all income sources starts, the next tasks are to record financial data in a budget spreadsheet and finalize the budget, they should be done in parallel. Once all pre-tasks are performed, the approval should be requested from the top management. The process is now concluded.
